messages.content:
On Thursday you will finally get to vote in this crucial General Election. 
I was first elected in 2010, and re-elected just two years ago. I live in the heart of the constituency with my young family and have worked hard to establish myself as a reliable and experienced constituency MP able to get things done.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The NHS has been my priority since day one and I will always fight for safe and sustainable local services, in the acute setting as well as across primary care, social care and community services. We will increase spending by a minimum of £8 billion in real terms over the next five years.

Equally on schools, and with small children of my own, I am passionate about education. We will increase the overall schools budget by £4 billion and ensure that no school has its budget cut as a result of the new fair funding formula. I argued for this within Government based on feedback from constituents.

mentions.candidate: As your MP, I can ensure our voice is heard at the heart of Government.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Either Theresa May or Jeremy Corbyn will be in No.10 Downing Street so your vote really matters.
mentions.partyLeader: Because of my role as a Minister in Theresa May’s team

issues.brexitEurope: Finally, as someone who voted Remain in the Brexit referendum, I will continue to be a measured voice that respects both sides of the referendum as Brexit is delivered, focusing on unity over division ... so we can move forward together and get a good deal for our country.
issues.education: Equally on schools, and with small children of my own, I am passionate about education. We will increase the overall schools budget by £4 billion and ensure that no school has its budget cut as a result of the new fair funding formula. I argued for this within Government based on feedback from constituents.
issues.health: The NHS has been my priority since day one and I will always fight for safe and sustainable local services, in the acute setting as well as across primary care, social care and community services. We will increase spending by a minimum of £8 billion in real terms over the next five years.

community.content: Campaigning on key local issues is very important to me. I have never followed whipped up sensationalist causes; preferring to work around the key relationships I have built. That allows me to be effective and understand the issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: I live in the heart of the constituency with my young family and have worked hard to establish myself as a reliable and experienced constituency MP able to get things done. Through my casework, I have helped thousands of constituents since I was first elected. It’s the part of this job you will never read about in newspapers but I get results when people need my help.

We will increase spending by a minimum of £8 billion in real terms over the next five years.
